input: An offensive player makes a fake move toward the ball, then quickly changes direction and sprints behind their defender toward the basket.
A player at the top of the key passes to the wing and then immediately cuts to the block off a high post screen.
Two teammates stand side-by-side to set a wider, more difficult screen for a shooter to run around.
A shooter runs between two teammates who are standing shoulder-to-shoulder; the screeners 'close the door' once the player passes through.
A ball handler drives toward a teammate who is standing still; they perform a hand-off exchange where the teammate acts as a screen.
A three-person action involving a high pick and roll where a third player sets a back screen for the original screener.
The big man defender stays back in the paint to protect the rim during a pick and roll instead of coming up to the screen.
A defensive strategy where the defender forces the ball handler toward the sideline and away from the screen on a side pick and roll.
An off-ball player acts as if they are going to set a screen but slips to the basket before making contact.
A 'junk' defense where one player guards the opponent's best scorer man-to-man while the other four play a zone in a square.
A player sprints from the baseline to the elbow or top of the key to receive a pass, running across the free-throw line.
One player sets a screen for another player, who then immediately receives a screen themselves from a third teammate.
A defensive move where the big man defender jumps out past the screen to momentarily stop the ball handler before recovering.
Two screens set one after the other in a line, requiring the defender to fight through both to stay with the shooter.
A screen set for a ball handler in transition, often before the defense has had a chance to set up.
A screen set on the back of a defender who is guarding a teammate away from the ball, allowing a cut to the rim.
A screen set by a perimeter player for a post player to help them get open across the lane near the basket.
A screen set for a player who is moving away from the ball toward the perimeter for an open jump shot.
A ball handler passes to the wing and then sets a screen for a player on the opposite side of the court.
A player cuts from the baseline up to the wing or top of the key off a screen set at the elbow or block.
A screen set at an angle, usually for a player in the corner to cut toward the opposite elbow or high post.
An off-ball player curls around a screen toward the basket instead of popping out to the perimeter for a shot.
A player cuts away from the ball and the screen, usually toward the corner, because the defender cheated over the screen.
A quick explosive cut made by a post player from the low block up to the high post or elbow to receive the ball.
A shooter starts under the basket and has the choice to run off a screen on either the left or right side of the lane.
The most common zone defense where two players stay high at the foul line and three players guard the baseline area.
A zone defense that puts high pressure on the wings with three players across the free-throw line and two on the blocks.
A diamond-shaped zone defense with one player at the top, three across the middle, and one player under the rim.
A defensive strategy where defenders aggressively double-team the ball handler immediately after they use a ball screen.
A man-to-man defense where off-ball defenders stay inside an imaginary line to prevent drives and clog the paint.
An offensive alignment featuring two players at the elbows, two in the corners, and a point guard at the top.
A quick-hitter play where a post player at the high post passes to a wing and immediately follows with a screen for them.
A play where a shooter starts under the basket and runs off two consecutive screens set at the elbow or wing.
An inbound play where four players line up in a straight row facing the ball before breaking in different directions.
A play where a player on the block sets a screen for a player in the corner, who then cuts baseline to the opposite side.
An offensive action where the ball is passed into the low post, and the passer immediately cuts off the post player's shoulder.
A strategy where every defensive player switches their assignment whenever any screen is set on the floor.
A full-court defense where the team stays in their man-to-man assignments and applies pressure the entire length of the floor.
A defensive adjustment where the defender goes beneath the screen to prevent a drive, conceding a long-range shot.
A coverage where the defender stays between their man and the ball at all times, aiming to prevent any catch.
A zone defense where one player guards the point and the other four players form a diamond shape behind them.
A specialized 'junk' defense where two players play man-to-man and the other three play a zone in a triangle shape.
A defensive tactic where two defenders momentarily trap the ball handler to force a turnover, often in the corner.
A defensive maneuver where a player leaves their assigned man to stop a teammate's man who has beaten them on a drive.
A full-court zone press that traps the ball handler in the backcourt corners using a 2-2-1 player formation.
A baseline defensive strategy where the defender stands in front of the post player to prevent an entry pass.
A play where three players are on the baseline; the middle player screens for one side, then turns to screen for the other.
A high-post action where two players at the elbows set a 'gate' for a guard coming from the baseline to run through.
A transition play where the ball handler drives to one side while a trailer follows to receive a drop-pass for a shot.
A move where a player acts as if they are setting a screen but sprints away from the ball handler to an open spot.
